notes_display: Hole at 9 h; Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing to the left, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.mzdysn bgy šh[p]whly MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n|mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ēran ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"the Mazda-worshiping divine shapur, king of kings of the Iranian and non-Iranians , whose image/brilliance is from the gods”
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, connected across the shaft; on altar shaft symbols (SNS 3, var. 25); four altar plates; above altar flames depicted by vertical lines; four altar plates; above flames depicted by vertical lines, to the left and the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur II, holding a barsom in both hands, both facing inwards; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 4 h l. o. šhpwhly ; 9h l. o. NWRA ZY |ādur ī Šābuhr|“the fire of Shapur”; symbol on altar shaft (SNS 3, var.25)
